meanings.definition: Completely change (something) in a radical way.
meanings.sent1: The new technology revolutionized the way we communicate.
meanings.sent2: The invention of the wheel revolutionized transportation.
meanings.sent3: The talking dog revolutionized the comedy scene.
meanings.sent4: Her unexpected arrival revolutionized the party atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The colorful paint revolutionized the dull room into a vibrant space.

meanings.definition: Cause a revolution in (a particular area or activity).
meanings.sent1: His speech revolutionized the students' perspective on history.
meanings.sent2: The internet revolutionized the way we access information.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meow revolutionized the quiet library.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm revolutionized the calm summer evening.
meanings.sent5: The chef's secret ingredient revolutionized the taste of the dish.
